quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and New Guinea
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, kemet, egypt. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What sea borders Egypt to the east?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Sea

questions.question: In the country of Papua New Guinea, how many children does the average woman give birth to during her lifetime according to 2006 estimates?
The west half of the island of New Guinea is part of Indonesia, which comprises how many islands?
Approximately what percentage of the population of the country of Papua New Guinea lives in rural areas?
The country of Papua New Guinea gained its independence from this country in 1975.
What is the official language spoken in Egypt?
The island of New Guinea was named after the country of Guinea. Which is Guinea located?
The islands of the Pacific are collectively termed Oceania. Oceania is divided into several sub-groupings. In which of these is New Guinea located?
What Egyptian city is the largest city not only in Africa, but also in the whole Middle East?
What is the literal translation of the title of the national anthem of Egypt, Bilady, Bilady, Bilady?

options.text: My country, my country, my country

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My country, my country, my country

questions.question: New Guinea is an island north of Australia. It is divided into 2 roughly equal halves. What are they?

options.text: The western portion is part of Australia. The eastern portion is the country called Sumatra.
The western portion is part of Indonesia. The eastern portion is the country called Papua New Guinea.
The western portion is part of Indonesia. The eastern portion is the country called Sumatra.
The western portion is part of Australia. The eastern portion is the country called Papua New Guinea.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The western portion is part of Indonesia. The eastern portion is the country called Papua New Guinea.

questions.question: Where is New Guinea ranked in terms of size, among the islands of the world?

options.text: New Guinea is the third largest island in the world.
New Guinea is the fourth largest island in the world.
New Guinea is the second largest island in the world.
New Guinea is the largest island in the world.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Guinea is the second largest island in the world.

questions.question: Why was Egypt called Kemet, or black land, back in the ancient times?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of the black soils

questions.question: What is the capital city of the country of Papua New Guinea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Port Moresby

questions.question: New Guinea is the most linguistically diverse area in the world. Approximately how many separate languages are spoken there?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Luxembourg and World
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, egypts, egypt. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How does Luxembourg, which is a member of NATO, contribute to NATO?

options.text: by maintaining the sixth largest NATO air force
by allowing extensive US and British military installations on its territory
by financially supporting a navy even though is has no coastline

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: by maintaining a small army

questions.question: Luxembourg is bordered by all of the following nations except this one.
What sport is rated as the most popular sport among Egyptians?
What is the official name of Luxembourg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grand Duchy of Luxembourg

questions.question: The flag of Luxembourg consists of three vertical stripes of red, blue, green.
The Egyptian territory is calculated to be roughly twice as large as the territory of this European country.
Why is Luxembourg City one of the wealthiest cities in the world?

options.text: It is the European center of computer and computer related companies.
There is great mineral wealth in the area around the city.
It is a banking and administrative center.
Rich retired people have ranked it as the most desirable place in Europe to live.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a banking and administrative center.

questions.question: What expression is commonly used in Egypt to refer to the annual flooding of the river Nile, the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gift of the Nile

questions.question: What languages are spoken in Luxembourg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the predominant religion in Luxembourg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Catholic

questions.question: Which of the following organizations is Luxembourg a member of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Luxembourg was not involved in any 20th century war.
Luxembourg has a population of approximately how many people?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: one half million

questions.question: What animal is depicted on Egypts national emblem, which is featured on the national flag of Egypt, adopted in 1984?
Where was Omar Sharif, one of the most famous Egyptian actors, born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexandria, Egypt

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Planet
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what Asian country is the Mount Unzen volcanic group located?
What is the name of the tallest waterfall in Asia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannoki Falls

questions.question: The area around what Italian volcano is the most densely populated volcanic region in the world, making the volcano one of the most dangerous on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Vesuvius

questions.question: In which U.S. state is the Multnomah Falls located?
In what country is Virginia Falls located?
The Santorini volcanic islands are part of what European country?
The Eas a Chual Aluinn is the highest waterfall in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Britain

questions.question: What is the English name of the Mosi-oa-Tunya waterfall located between Zambia and Zimbabwe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victoria Falls

questions.question: What is the name of the highest waterfall in North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Bruce Falls

questions.question: In what country is Gocta Waterfall located?
Where is the third-tallest waterfall on the planet, Ramnefjellsfossen, located?
This Andean stratovolcano in Colombia erupted in 1993, killing 9 people.
In what country is Yumbilla Falls, the fifth-tallest waterfall on the planet, located?
What does the name of the Iguazu Falls, located in South America, mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big water

questions.question: What is the name of the largest volcano on Earth in terms of area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mauna Loa

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, bush, none. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Russian volcano, located on the Kamchatka Peninsula, is one of the most active volcanoes on the planet.
What is the capital of Illinois, the 21st US State?
Amelia Earhart, the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic, was born in what city and state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atchison, Kansas

questions.question: Who is the 16th president of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: This city, located in Colorado, is the highest city in the United States.
President George W. Bush was inaugurated on January 20, 2000.
On which of the Philippine islands is the active Taal Volcano located?
None of these  could be found in Europe before the Great Geographical Discoveries:
What is the name of the dangerous active volcano located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Santa Maria

questions.question: Malcolm X, the founder of the Organization of Afro-American Unity,  was born in what US city?
Makawao is the capital of the State of Hawaii.
The city of Saint Louis, nicknamed Gateway to the West, is located in which state?
This countrys national holidays include:
What is the highest point in the state of Illinois?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Mound

questions.question: On which of the Canary Islands is the Mount Teide volcano located?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Desert and Worlds
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, kilometres, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Australian desert of nearly 600,000 square kilometres is famous for its spectacular land and rock formations, such as Uluru and Kata Tjuta, its estimated 1,100 parallel dunes running north-south, and the fresh water lake, Rainbow Valley.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simpson Desert

questions.question: Russia is the worlds largest country, with a land area of 17,098,242 square kilometers.
The largest natural karst crater on Earth - Ramon Crater, with a length of 40 km (25 miles) and width of 2 to 10 km (1.5 to 6 miles), is situated in the heart of this Middle East desert.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Negev desert

questions.question: Which one of these countries is largest in area?

options.text: Jordan and Japan are equal in size

questions.question: Which of the following countries is the worlds smallest continent, and can also be considered an island since it is surrounded by water?
Rangipo Desert in the central part of New Zealands North Island, does not have its barren and lifeless appearance because of the lack of rain, but rather, due to which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soil structure

questions.question: Leonardo of Pisa or Leonardo Pisano, also known as Fibonacci, was an Italian mathematician and is best known for the discovery of the Fibonacci numbers, which form the following sequence.

options.text: you know what the next number is?

questions.question: According to the United States Census Bureau in 2006, China was the most populated country in the world.

In geography, the term desert is used to refer to a region that receives little or no precipitation. Approximately one-third of Earths land surface is desert, with the largest such region being which of these?
Which of the following oceans is the worlds largest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pacific Ocean

questions.question: The Atacama Desert of Chile and Peru is one of the driest and most lifeless places on Earth. This virtually rainless plateau is made up of sand, lava flows, and what other substance?
Arrange the following oceans by their total area, starting with the largest:
This African desert, famous for its enormous sand dunes, is considered the oldest desert in the world, having endured its current arid conditions for at least 80 million years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Namib Desert

questions.question: The Kalahari Desert, meaning great thirst translated from the local language, is a vast area of red-brown sands, taking up a considerable area of which of these regions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: Finish the lyrics of the official state song of California, I Love You, California written by F. B. Silverwood:

options.text: It is home sweet home to me.
You are very dear to me.
It is where I want to be.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is home sweet home to me.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Country and Tune
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, yugoslavia, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Myanmar is a south-eastern Asian country. Under which name was it known before a military junta took over?
The African kingdom of Dahomey was powerful in the XVIII century. Which modern day country did it cover?
Which independent country was not a Soviet republic?
Where were the Boer Republics located?

options.text: They were early Puritan settlements in the eastern North America

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Across South Africa

questions.question: Finish this Irish saying: A tune is more lasting than the song of birds. And a word is more lasting than ________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the wealth of the world

questions.question: The Ottoman Empire used to rule over North Africa, the Middle East and south-eastern Europe. Which modern day country is the successor of the empire?
Where was the late medieval kingdom of Aragon situated?

options.text: Eastern Spain, major islands on the Mediterranean Sea and southern Italy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eastern Spain, major islands on the Mediterranean Sea and southern Italy

questions.question: Pittsburgh is home to many universities and research facilities. One of them is described here:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carnegie Mellon University

questions.question: The Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation was a loosely coupled union of mostly German speaking principalities. Which part of the union was the driver of the 19th century unification of Germany?
By the end of the 16th century, a country called Commonwealth of Both Nations covered almost 1 million square kilometers of Europe. Which two countries formed it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland and Lithuania

questions.question: When Yugoslavia collapsed, one of its republics became an independent state known as FYROM. To which country does the acronym refer?
Which central European countrys all pre-1989 neighbors do not exist any more? The country is now bordered by 7 states.
This is the worlds smallest independent state with a population in 2007 of approximately 821.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vatican City

questions.question: Phoenicia was an ancient civilization that spread maritime trade over the Mediterranean Sea. From where did the Phoenicians originate?

options.text: Greek islands on the Aegean Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Modern day Liban (Sidon, Tyre)

questions.question: Where was the monastic state of the Teutonic Knights located?

options.text: Seperated spots on modern day German territory
Northern Poland, southern Lithuania, part of Latvia and the Russian enclave of Kaliningrad
Malta and other islands on the Mediterranean

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Northern Poland, southern Lithuania, part of Latvia and the Russian enclave of Kaliningrad
